abstract: Steel Partners, the hedge fund run by financier Warren Lichtenstein, may once again find itself circumvented in a bid for a Japanese target. This time the activist hedge fund is gunning for Japanese brewer Sapporo Holdings, seeking to raise its stake in the beer maker to 66.6 percent in preparation for an eventual buyout.
lead_paragraph: Steel Partners, the hedge fund run by financier Warren Lichtenstein, may once again find itself circumvented in a bid for a Japanese target. This time the activist hedge fund is gunning for Japanese brewer Sapporo Holdings, seeking to raise its stake in the beer maker to 66.6 percent in preparation for an eventual buyout.

headline.main: A Possible Hitch in Hedge Fund’s Sapporo Plans
